page.title: 02Landscape Through Our Eyes
page.content:
We are surrounded by daisies and buttercups ,I can hear a tractor clattering ,about sixty birds have just flown over .The tractor seems to be coming closer by the sound.There's about eight houses near us.A lorry has just turned into a farm.To my right there is a caravan site with about fifty vans.In a garden near us there is a man building a shed.
The roaring of a tractor's engine broken by the speech of Mrs. Yates. Crows squawking,I can see a caravan park across the field and two old sinks.Across the lane I can see Kestle Farm.I'm surrounded by hundreds of daisies I can hear the rippling stream,and the occasional sparkle of the sun through the trees.I can see the slates of a house.In my sight is a church and an old fashioned plough.
